intro: Polyosma reducta, commonly known as the slender rock heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
